awd_titl_txt: Homologies between Expression Domains of Pattern-ControllingGenes in Protochordates and Vertebrates: A new way of eval. Hypotheses on the Origin of the vert. from the Invertebrates
awd_abstract_narration: Dr. Holland proposes to work at the interface between the fields of             evolution and development with the overall purpose of understanding             the origin of the vertebrates from the invertebrates. The most                  tractable goal is to establish homologies between expression                    domains of pattern controlling genes (e.g. homeobox genes) during               ontogeny of lancelets (amphioxus) and tunicates. These genes will               be isolated and sequenced and will be used to prepare riboprobes                and antibodies for detection of the gene products within the                    context of the embryonic and larval tissues. By comparing the                   protochordate expression domains to those already known for                     developing vertebrates, Dr. Holland the can generate unprecedented              new homologies and use them to evaluate existing theories of                    vertebrate origins and possibly as a basis for new hypotheses. The              initial study has already yielded new insights into the                         evolutionary origin of the vertebrate head and brain.

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
